alert.note: Alert for Florence (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 13 at 10:01AM CDT until April 17 at 4:36PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: .Unseasonably warm temperatures combined with rapid snow melt has resulted in high flows below the Kingsford and Big Quinnesec Dams. These fast flows are expected to persist into this weekend. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Hydrologic flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Wisconsin, including the following counties, Florence and Marinette. * WHEN...Until 700 AM CDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. The fast flows may cause damage to shoreline property including boats and piers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 953 AM CDT, Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Niagara and Aurora. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
